content: During the fourth quarter, our bookings for CJ grew 17% year-over-year, and our revenue renewal and retention rates were excellent, coming in at 98% and 117%. Our average annual revenue for CJ recruitment package customer was up 3% over last quarter and up 11% year-over-year to $19,872. Fourth quarter operating expenses were $39 million compared to $33.6 million in the year ago quarter, as we continue to invest in our sales team as well as third-party marketing spend to drive increases in marketing qualified leads. Adjusted EBITDA for the fourth quarter was $8.1 million, a margin of 20% compared to $7.1 million or a margin of 21% in the fourth quarter a year ago. Deferred revenue at the end of the quarter was $50.9 million, up 10% from the fourth quarter of last year. Our total committed contract backlog at the end of the quarter was $117.3 million, which was up 27% from the end of the fourth quarter last year. Long-term backlog that is revenue to be recognized in 13 or more months was $25.8 million at the end of the quarter, an increase of $12.1 million or 88% from the prior year.
